message: But, also, more seriously, The Gordon. It's brewed by Oscar Blues out of Chicago. The tagline on the can is "BIG STICKY RED" and that is the *perfect* description of the beer.
Me love PBR.
Alaskan Amber
I love beer.
Nothing beats Damnation
hi
Anchor Steam and Anchor Humming ftw. In the UK I like Wadworth 6X. Awww yeah.

Hitachino Nest Red Rice ale is one of my long time favorites.  Also Allagash Tripel Reserve, oh and a new one I just came across Fysus (misread as Tysus, and then accordingly nicknamed Mike Tysus) which stands for Fuck Your Shit Up Sideways.
I like me some Blue Moon Winter Abbey Ale.
You guys should check out http://untappd.com/
i like natural ice
yea , kickarse !

I'm a big fan of our local microbreweries here in the Maritimes—Garrison Brewing, Propeller Brewing, Pumphouse, and Picaroon's. We've got some top quality brews here that are starting to make their way into the rest of Canada.
@spencer Anchor Steam is absolutely my favorite, but it doesn't age well; get too far from San Francisco and it just isn't as good. :( (/me lives in DC now)
i could use one right now....
Anyone here from Texas? Or like some of the Texan microbrews?
@joshourisman Anchor steam-like beers are called common ales generally, might be able to find one of them in your area. Though... there's much better beer out there :)
@johnroescher I've had some surprisingly good stuff from Mississippi, but not Texas - any recommendations? (related to SXSW thread)
I don't always drink beer, but when I do, I prefer Dos Equis.
Stay thirsty, my friends.
